gpcm.approx module¶

class gpcm.approx.MeanField(model, fit)[source]¶

Bases: gpcm.approx.Approximation

Mean-field approximation of the GPCM.

Parameters

  • model (gpcm.AbstractGPCM) – Instantiated GPCM.

  • fit (str) – Fitting method. Must be one of ca, bfgs, collapsed-bfgs.

elbo[source]¶

Compute the mean-field ELBO.

Parameters

  • state (random state, optional) – Random state.

  • t (vector) – Locations of observations.

  • y (vector) – Observations.

  • collapsed (str, optional) – Collapse over \(z\) or \(u\).

Returns

ELBO

Return type

scalar

predict[source]¶

Predict.

Parameters

t (vector) – Points to predict at.

Returns

Marginals of the predictions.

Return type

tuple[vector, vector]

Predict Fourier features under the mean-field approximation.

Returns

Marginals of the predictions.

Return type

tuple[vector, vector]

sample_kernel[source]¶

Sample kernel under the mean-field approximation.

Parameters

  • t_k (vector) – Time point to sample at.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

Samples.

Return type

tensor

class gpcm.approx.Structured[source]¶

Bases: gpcm.approx.Approximation

Structured approximation of the GPCM.

elbo[source]¶

Fit a mean-field approximation and compute an estimate of the resulting ELBO collapsed over \(q(z|u)\).

Parameters

  • state (random state, optional) – Random state.

  • t (vector) – Locations of observations.

  • y (vector) – Observations.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

ELBO.

Return type

scalar

elbo_collapsed_z[source]¶

Compute an estimate of the ELBO collapsed over \(q(z|u)\).

Parameters

  • state (random state) – Random state.

  • t (vector) – Locations of observations.

  • y (vector) – Observations.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples to use. Defaults to 1000.

Returns

Random state and ELBO.

Return type

tuple[random state, scalar]

elbo_gibbs[source]¶

Compute an estimate of the structured ELBO ignoring the entropy of the optimal \(q(u)\).

Parameters

  • state (random state) – Random state.

  • t (vector) – Locations of observations.

  • y (vector) – Observations.

  • u (matrix) – Current sample for \(u\).

  • z (matrix) – Current sample for \(z\).

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of Gibbs samples. Defaults to 5.

Returns

Random state, ELBO, updated

sample for \(u\), and updated sample for \(z\).

Return type

tuple[random state, scalar, matrix, matrix]

log_Z_u[source]¶

Compute the normalising constant term of the optimal \(q(z|u)\).

Parameters

  • ts (types.SimpleNamespace) – Terms.

  • u (tensor) – Sample for \(u\) to use.

Returns

Normalising constant term.

Return type

scalar
